intro: Elytrospermum californicum, commonly known as California starflower, is a flowering plant native to California and parts of Oregon. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, typically blooming in spring and early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its low maintenance requirements and ability to attract pollinators.
